reviews.review_text: Ticks along at a merry pace.

The title of this book is likely the nonstop duration you'll spend reading, spellbound by Meyer's deft ability to draw you in to an increasingly intense and layered plot. Not coy in its complexity, but respectful of its reader "Thirteen Hours" will have you tucked away in your reading nook reveling in a great story and, even better, your new fave author. Pick it up, fall in love.
After 7 hrs I thought it must be all clear. But he got me hooked for the other 7 as well.

Again inspector Benny doesn't disappoint. It's amazing how he can take in so much information from interviews and crime scenes and make sense of it all. This book litteraly has you running for your life up and down the streets of Capetown. Very well written with clear explanations of South Africa's many races. Fantastic book, quick paced, you won't be able to put it down until it's finished.
Skillfully written suspense! Allways keeps you guessing as to what is next. You won't be able to put it down.
Deon Meyer is one of my favourite authors.
First time reader of Deon Meyer. The story kept me gripped from page 1. Loved being able to picture where it was all taking place.

Very popular writer, as a SA living abroad I liked best him mentioning places that I recalled or words or mannerisms familiar to me. I felt that the plot was flawed with lots of holes but if you are not a picky reader you will enjoy this.
A page turner with twists and turns until the very end. And even then, you want it to continue. A great crime novel.

summary:
Book 2/5 in Benny Griessel

Fast-paced, powerful, tender and suspenseful, Thirteen Hours is a blisteringly good novel from one of the major crime writers on the world stage.

Some would call Detective Benny Griessel a legend. Others would call him a drunk. Either way, he has trodden on too many toes over the years ever to reach the top of his profession, and now he must concentrate on staying sober and mentoring the next generation of crime fighters - from the many ethnic backgrounds that make up South Africa. 

But when an American backpacker disappears in Capetown, panicked politicians know who they have to call: Benny has just thirteen hours to save the girl, save his career - and crack open a conspiracy which threatens the whole country.

"What makes this novel so outstanding is its setting... and Meyer's superlative talent for suspense... Above all though, this is a vigorous, exciting novel that combines memorable characters and plot with edge-of-the-seat suspense." The Sunday Times
